definition: decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate

sentences.english: He gave the picture a few finishing touches.
sentences.chinese: 他給這副畫作了幾筆最後的潤飾。

sentences.english: One or two small pinholes were all I could find that need touching up.
sentences.chinese: 一個或兩個小針孔，都是我可以找到需要潤飾。

sentences.english: Stop obfuscating the information and embellishing it.
sentences.chinese: 不要再刻意潤飾各種一塌糊塗的信息了。

sentences.english: How much were they altered or embellished?
sentences.chinese: 它們被改變或潤飾的程度如何？

sentences.english: In the second draft, you can refine and polish the way you've expressed it.
sentences.chinese: 在第二份草稿中，您可以對您的描述進行改進並潤飾。

sentences.english: He wrote an article, then buffed it up through several drafts.
sentences.chinese: 他寫了一篇文章，然後數易其稿加以潤飾。

sentences.english: The writing style without polished have set us a good example to the aftertime translation of Scriptures.
sentences.chinese: 那不加潤飾的文風給後世譯經事業留下一個好榜樣。

sentences.english: Once the image is retouched, we need a few more revisions done.
sentences.chinese: 一旦圖像潤飾，我們更需要一些修改完成。

sentences.english: Yet you also stress the importance of forms and prosody in polishing and revising poetry.
sentences.chinese: 可你又強調形式與詩體論對潤飾修改詩的重要性。

sentences.english: We will also ask you to retouch these pictures.
sentences.chinese: 我們也將要求你潤飾這些圖片。

sentences.english: Hi, I'm looking for a photo retouch artist to work on several photos.
sentences.chinese: 嗨，我正在尋找一個攝影藝術家潤飾工作幾張照片。

definition: to interpret (a visual document, a medical exam, an historical event etc)/to analyze data (from a chip, a black box etc)
